journal.title: Agent Architecture: Thin Wrapper Pattern
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content:
Refactored agent files to be thin wrappers around skills.

**Change:**
- Before: Agent files duplicated all CLI command details, workflows, and operational logic from skills (~500 lines each, 1,516 total)
- After: Agent files now simply invoke their corresponding skill and report results (~80-100 lines each)

**Benefits:**
- Single source of truth (skills contain all operational logic)
- Easier maintenance (only update skills when CLI changes)
- Reduced duplication (~1,300 lines removed, 85% reduction)
- Clearer separation (agents = orchestration, skills = execution)
- Faster agent loading (smaller context for haiku model)

**Pattern:**
Agents now follow this structure:
1. Define when to use the agent
2. Invoke: Skill(sdd-toolkit:{skill-name})
3. Report results back to the user

This architectural decision affects sdd-update.md, sdd-plan-review.md, and sdd-validate.md, establishing a consistent pattern for future agent implementations.
